trip

Class Leprechaun

  • java.lang.Object
    • trip.Leprechaun

  • public class Leprechaun
extends java.lang.Object
    Leprechaun class is used to represent a Leprechaun caracterized by its name, position, and facing direction. His rank is also defined.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Leprechaun()
      constructs a leprechaun whose name is nobody, position is 0,0, and is facing the NORD direction.
      Leprechaun(java.lang.String name, Position p)
      constructs a leprechaun whose name is name, position is p, and is facing to the NORD direction.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void avance()
      Modifies the position of the Leprechaun by one steps in the direction the Leprechaun is facing.
      void avance(int nbPas)
      Modifies the position of the Leprechaun using the specified number of steps, and the direction the Leprechaun is facing.
      java.lang.String getDirection() 
      java.lang.String getName() 
      Position getPosition() 
      java.lang.String toString() 
      void turn()
      Modifies the direction the Leprechaun is facing, following an anti-clockwise pattern.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Leprechaun

        public Leprechaun()
        constructs a leprechaun whose name is nobody, position is 0,0, and is facing the NORD direction.

      • Leprechaun

        public Leprechaun(java.lang.String name,
          Position p)
        constructs a leprechaun whose name is name, position is p, and is facing to the NORD direction.
        Parameters:
        name - a String containing the Leprechaun's name.
        p - a valid Position object.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name of the Leprechaun.

      • getDirection

        public java.lang.String getDirection()
        Returns:
        the direction the Leprechaun is facing.

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Returns:
        the position of the Leprechaun.

      • avance

        public void avance(int nbPas)
        Modifies the position of the Leprechaun using the specified number of steps, and the direction the Leprechaun is facing.
        Parameters:
        nbPas - the number of steps to be taken in the direction the leprechaun is facing.

      • avance

        public void avance()
        Modifies the position of the Leprechaun by one steps in the direction the Leprechaun is facing.

      • turn

        public void turn()
        Modifies the direction the Leprechaun is facing, following an anti-clockwise pattern. e.g. a NORD facing Leprechaun will be facing OUEST after the method is called.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string representing the object The new representation looks like : Name => name. Rang => rank. Position => pos. Direction => dir.
